head.og_title: WebP to AVIF Converter - Free & Online

h1.title: Convert WebP to AVIF Online
h1.description: Free and fast WebP to AVIF converter with excellent compression and quality. Works instantly on any device — no signup required.

description:
Upgrade your images by converting WebP to AVIF. AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a next-gen format that often produces smaller files at similar visual quality. Our tool preserves transparency and converts color to sRGB for web consistency.

Note: If your WebP is animated, only the first frame is converted to a static AVIF image.

converter.title: WebP to AVIF Converter
converter.description: Convert WebP images to AVIF with high quality and excellent compression.

h2.title: Why Convert WebP to AVIF?
h2.description:
AVIF is built on the AV1 codec and targets superior efficiency:

  • Smaller Files: Frequently 15–30% smaller than comparable WebP at similar quality.
  • High Quality: Better detail retention at lower bitrates.
  • Modern & Future-proof: Broad and growing browser support.
  • Transparency: Full alpha channel support like WebP.

h2.title: How to Convert WebP to AVIF Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload WebP and select your file.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download AVIF to save the result.

Defaults balance fidelity and size for the modern web.

h2.title: AVIF vs WebP Comparison
h2.description:
• Compression: AVIF generally achieves smaller files at similar quality.
  • Transparency: Both support alpha channels.
  • Animation: This tool outputs static AVIF (first frame only).
  • Browser Support: AVIF is supported by current versions of major browsers.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: WebP (image/webp)
  • Maximum file size: 16 MB per file
  • Output: AVIF (.avif, image/avif)
  • Animation: First frame only

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Colors look different: Output is converted to sRGB for web consistency.
  • File still large: Try a higher cqLevel (e.g., 34–36) or downscale before converting.
  • Upload fails: Ensure image/webp and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Is this WebP to AVIF converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, it’s completely free with no watermarks or hidden charges.

faq.question: Will AVIF work on all browsers?
faq.answer: AVIF is supported by modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge). Provide WebP or JPG fallbacks for older versions.

faq.question: How much smaller are AVIF files vs WebP?
faq.answer: Results vary by image, but AVIF is often 15–30% smaller at similar visual quality.

faq.question: Does it keep transparency?
faq.answer: Yes. If your WebP has an alpha channel, the AVIF output preserves it.

faq.question: Do you support animated WebP?
faq.answer: Animated WebP is converted as a static image using the first frame.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

note: AVIF is highly efficient but may render a bit slower on very old devices. For maximum compatibility, keep your original WebP as a fallback.
